conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for the Northern Negotiators event.
You did well in the negotiations with Chanzelia, Joachim. I leave that manacaster in your hands—use it well.
You sure? This is the only one we ended up with, so protocol says it's yours.
I care about resources being in the best hands, not protocol. Speaking of which, isn't it time you considered the promotion?
Buh?
Care to try a more intelligent response? HQ has been asking for a while now.
Yeees, but I'm pretty sure I told you I had to humbly pass on their offer.
You did indeed say that— but I never said I approved.
...You're killing me here.
I understand your reasons for turning down every promotion you're offered, and I'm in no position to butt in given my role...
But HQ isn't interested in your sentimental reasonings. You're a soldier.
I need you to make yourself useful, Joachim. Don't let me down.
Commander, I don't—
I want your answer by the time you return to base, soldier. Now, I have matters to attend to, so I'm going on ahead.
Oh, don't let her down? Is that all? Ugh.
(Great, I'm already back at base and I'm STILL not done fretting.)
Er, s-sorry, Joachim,  but you seem kind of...down. Are you okay?
Oh, uh, yeah. Fine. Nothing you need to worry yourself about, Noelle.
But I DO worry. Also, Kirsty told me to look in on you. Er, actually she ordered me.
Thanks a lot, Kirsty... Ugh, okay. So you know how I got offered a promotion before this mission?
Th-that was the letter from HQ that I delivered to you, right?!
Right. Kirsty's telling me to accept it, but I keep trying to turn her down. That's what's got me spinning at the moment.
Wait. You...don't want the promotion?
If I take it, I'm suddenly a big shot—maybe even the kind of big shot who has a whole squadron serving under him.
And I'm not the kind of guy who should have ANYONE'S life in his hands.
Why not?
It's...kind of embarrassing.
*stare*
Little intense there, Noelle. Maybe ease up on the whole peering-into-my-soul thing.
*staaaare*
Fine! I'll talk! Just don't do that any more. Oh, and you can't tell this to anyone.
So seven years ago, I commanded a platoon. I was young, and—frankly— sort of an idiot.
...And that's how I got my sister killed.
We were deployed right into the war with Barthe. I gave it all I had—which wasn't much—but soon the enemy was a step ahead at every turn.
But my sister was a part of the volunteer medical corps stationed at our base, so I couldn't back off. I fought like hell to keep her safe, but one day...
*pant* *wheeze* *gasp* Oh man, this is NOTHING like training...
But she's counting on me back at base. We have to hold the line here!
...Er, hang on. Does it seem like there are fewer enemies than normal today?
U-urgent report, Captain!
Go on.
Message from the base, sir! They need immediate reinforcements! Barthe soldiers have breached our defenses!
What?! But we've been holding them here!
Th-they outflanked us, sir. Kept us pinned down here while they sent a detachment around to cut off our supply line.
...Dammit! Everyone, move out NOW!

I sprinted the whole way there, but it was too late. The base was in flames, the defenses in shambles. When we finally managed to push them back, I started running through the base like a crazy man desperately searching for my sister.
Sis?! Where are you?!
It's safe now! You can come out!
Joa...chim? Is...that you?
Sis!
I'm glad...you're safe... Heh. But looks like you got kicked around real good.
Stop talking and just be still, Sis. We need to get you patched up.
Don't... It won't matter. But you need to take care of all those bumps and bruises...
Dammit, I told you to stop moving!
Joachim... You...have to live.
This isn't the time to... Sis?
Sis, no... NO!
GRAAAAAAGH!
I was green, and the enemy outplayed me. I lost a large part of my platoon... and my own sister, too.
If anyone else had been in command, she'd still be alive.
Y-you can't know that for sure.
That's why I got no interest in climbing the ladder again.
An idiot who couldn't keep his only sister alive has no business making life-or-death decisions for anyone.
*sniff*
Hey, don't make that face, Noelle. I know how much Kirsty expects of me, and I'm grateful for it. Really.
But I just... I can't. Every time I try, my sister just pops into my head.
＂Don't let this happen to anyone else,＂ I hear her say.
B-but, Joachim, I... I think you—
Joachim! You're back!
Yep. What's got you all worked up?
It's an emergency! Commander Kirsty just got back, and she's been hauled off by Commander Balboa!
Oh, hell. Balboa's the poster boy for the faction backing the current king!
They might've found out about the letter she got from the resistance.
But... I mean, she hasn't written a reply! They have no grounds to hold her!
I'm sure they're looking to nip the issue in the bud—but she's a commander, so they also can't just lock her up on a whim.
What are they really after?
Huh? Okay, NOW what?!
W-we're under attack! The whole place is surrounded by an unknown force!
They brought serious numbers—I think they're looking to take the base!
Oh, this day just keeps getting better!
Commander Balboa's quarters, after the attack on the base begins...
Allow me to formally welcome you to my base, Commander. I trust you'll enjoy your stay. Tea? Or perhaps you're a coffee gal?
I'll pass, thanks. Instead, let's discuss why I'm here; I'm unaware of anything I've done to earn such a forceful invitation.
I do apologize—though you must admit you've resisted my prior overtures.
Yes, I've been rather busy of late. Apologies if I gave the wrong impression.
Perish the thought. I merely hoped to get to know you better—as two commanders of the Svenitlan forces, you understand.
This seems a perfect opportunity for us to indulge in a bit of small talk, yes?
Oh, do go on.
Are you aware that some within our great nation are toiling to dethrone the king? Imagine the sheer audacity of it!
I've heard vague rumors, though I tend not to put much stock in them.
If I thought you truly believed that, I'd have cause to reevaluate my opinion of you. But I think we both know better.
I expect you are quite familiar with the movement I refer to.
I won't bore you with questions. All I wish to know is whether you're with him or not.
And who, pray, might this mysterious ＂him＂ be?
We're both busy people, Commander— too busy to waste time on cheap farce. Answer my question.
You've taken the words out of my mouth, Commander: I haven't the time for this.
I demand to know on what grounds I am being subjected to this interrogation.
You and I are equal in rank, and I had intended to offer you every professional courtesy—but always remember that I do not answer to you.
Also, if you refuse to extend the same courtesy to me, I'm quite happy to answer in kind. Is that how you want this to go?
You fail to understand your current position, Commander.
And what position is that?
You've failed twice now. First regarding the alliance with Dyrenell, and now with the procurement of new weaponry.
I'm beginning to question your capabilities as a commander— and I'm not the only one.
You're likely one mistake short of being asked to resign. A mistake like, say, if the enemy were to lay claim to your base?
You wouldn't!
Yes, I hear roving bands of armed bandits are on the prowl of late. I pray they don't cause you any trouble.
Are you threatening me now, you dog?!
You're welcome to take it however you wish. Now let me repeat my query:
Just where does your allegiance lie, Commander Kirsty? Is it with your king... or perhaps somewhere else?
You know damn well I serve no master but Svenitla herself.
And this conversation has convinced me that I will crush every last locust gnawing at her body with my own two hands.
Will you, now?
It's a real shame, Commander, to see that you're not attached to your position OR the lives of your men.
Neither they nor I are so weak as to fall for your sad, two-bit schemes.
Oh? Then I shall look forward to the show. It will be quite the delight to see how long your precious men last... Heh heh heh.
R-reporting in... *scribble* Here!
...We're completely outnumbered. Not only that, but the enemy—they may be dressed like common bandits, but it sounds like they're actually the army in disguise.
Thanks, Noelle. Given the timing with what happened to Kirsty, it's probably safe to assume these are Balboa's lackeys.
So, how hosed are we, Aggie? How are supplies looking?
If we're just eating and sleeping, we've got enough to last a month. But if we're, you know, actually FIGHTING, our weapons aren't going to last.
Not surprised to hear it. So if a protracted siege is out, we'll need to settle things in one quick, decisive battle.
Bring it on! We'll show these curs how Kirsty's soldiers fight!
Grab your weapons, boys and girls! Defensive formation, just like in training!
Yeah!
Everyone slow down! These men are working for Balboa, which means they may be well-informed on our army's standard tactics.
You have a different plan, then?
I'm thinking we give 'em the old fake-out, and here's how...
The commander's too good to us; I can't believe we're all gonna get promotions just for mopping up a few traitors!
Sure, IF we live. These are well-trained solders we're going after here, which is why we all have orders to kill on sight.
So look sharp! The commander says they'll gather their forces at one point and launch a defensive—
Huh?! What's that sound?!
Looks like they're biting. Aggie! Marsh! You know what to do!
On it, sir. RAAAAAAAGH!
Sir, they're flooding out of the base from every which way! They even seem to be sprouting from the GROUND!
Hidden tunnels, is it? Well, this is their turf, so they were always going to have the terrain advantage! We'll just have to use our numbers to overpower them!
Yes, sir! Sealing approach rou—AAAH!
What now?!
Concentrated mana, sir! It's from an extremely long range, but it's coming in faster than anything I've ever seen!
Impossible. The brief said there were next to no mages stationed here!
WHAT?!
Well, looks like that's got 'em shook. The fact they know all about us means they're even less prepared for magic.
They weren't kidding when they said manacasters were big news... You're a one-man diversion, Joachim.
At the very least, you made 'em think twice about coming any closer.
Hey, it's all the manacaster, not me. Save the kudos for Chanzelia and Kirsty.
Aw, don't be so modest! I knew we'd be fine with you calling the shots.
...What?
Er, is that weird? I mean, you ARE Kirsty's right-hand man, after all. Why wouldn't you take command with her out?
Because you and me are practically the same rank, Aggie!
Only 'cause you turn down promotions like they're going out of style! But we all still know you've got what it takes to lead.
Yeah, you're the most decisive one here, so let's keep the pressure on these guys. Awaiting orders, Mr. Acting Commander!
...Let's all do what we can.
(Oh man, Joachim seems a little... Well, I just hope he's okay.)
The front line won't hold much longer, Joachim! What's our move here?!
Right, let's see... We give that position up for now and shore up defenses at point C.
Point F is prepped and ready, Joachim. Awaiting orders!
Okay, next we—
...Rrgh. These guys are really going all-in. They've got zero intention of giving ground!
We HAVE to have put a dent in them by this point. Just how much are they paying these guys, anyway?
Guess it just proves how big a threat they think Commander Kirsty is.
They're not wrong—she's a beast. But I don't see this stalemate lasting for long.
They'll make their move before much—
U-urgent report!
What's wrong?
*scribble* H-here!
...Enemy shows signs of preparing a final, all-out assault?
The crazy fools have gone suicidal... What kind of scale are we talking here?
D-definitely enough to breach the front barricade. It...it won't last long!
Ugh, fantastic. There's fearless, and then there's...whatever this is.
(They're a lot more dangerous than the numbers suggest if they're willing to die. We'll need to take risks to match that.)
(If we want to keep casualties down, we have to intercept them early and stop the push before things spiral out of hand.)
(But there's no way we get through that in one piece... Can I really own a decision I know is gonna result in losses?)
What do you think, Joachim? Any brilliant ideas?
Sorry, fresh out. This is a tricky one.
If even YOU say so, it must be true. Guess that means we'll just have to tough it out.
In that case, I think we should scale back defenses elsewhere and protect the center with our lives. Sound okay, Joachim?
R-right. Though we'll never hold if they break through from anywhere else. Let's leave a flying column at the midpoint.
Noelle, relay those orders to the others!
R-right!
I sure hope this works.
(But why can't I shake this feeling? This...dread?)
One hour later, at the front gates of Kirsty's base...
Gwaaargh!
Hnnnrgh!
Dammit! Fall back for now! We'll regroup, then crush them for good!
Yes, sir!
S-sorry, Aggie... I think this is... as far as I go...
Marsh! Ugh, dammit! We've got multiple wounded! Everybody who can still move, get these people inside! Medics, we need you now!
We're not out of this thing yet; we need to hurry up, before they come at us again.
*scribble* S-situation report, sir.
Damn, I didn't think they'd be this tough. Speaking of, how's Marsh doing?
He's, um, in critical condition. Medical is doing everything they can for him, but...
I won't let his sacrifice be in vain. We need a plan before the next wave... But, er, but what options do we have?
Joachim, what do you think? Joachim?
...Sorry.
Sorry for what?
This is all my fault.
(Eep!)
If I gave better orders—if I was prepared to do whatever it took and own up—then this wouldn't have happened.
It's my fault they got Marsh... It's my fault my sister is gone.
Joachim? The hell you talking about?
*fidget*
If I had only known the weight of that responsibility back then... The weight of holding a person's life in your hands...
UM, SIR?!
...Huh? Noelle?
I'm sorry, everyone, but I need to...um... talk to Joachim about a...thing!
Gonna borrow him for a second okay bye!
We need a minute to regroup here, anyway, so you can have your second.
Joachim, come with me NOW!
Gah, whoa! Where are you—?!
...Huh. I don't think I've ever heard Noelle raise her voice before.
And what was WITH Joachim, anyway?
The hell's gotten into you, Noelle? Why'd you drag me into Kirsty's office?
B-because if I don't t-tell you this now, I...I know I'll regret it!
Well? Spit it out, then.
After hearing about your sister, I couldn't just...watch you suffer like that.
That's when I remembered that Kirsty told me something, um, important here in her office once.
About what it means to...to be responsible for another's life.
I'll do my best to repeat it, so just listen. I'd done something...unforgivable and, um, this is what she told me!
An order I had delivered led to a squadron taking massive losses, and I was beside myself.
I'm sorry, Commander Kirsty. I'm so sorry! I messed up, and now everyone is—
Enough, Noelle. You carried out your mission as a messenger, which is all that anyone can ask.
B-but I'd noticed the orders were wrong, I should have...
A messenger's job is to relay the orders she's given, word for word. It's we officers who bear responsibility for the contents.
So any loss of life that resulted from this operation is on my hands, not yours. Got it?
That's not... How can it ALL be your responsibility, Commander?!
I c-can't accept that... I'd be scared to DEATH if all that responsibility was on me!
You're kind to say so. And yes, I AM scared to think of how many lives are resting on my narrow shoulders.
Just thinking about it is...dizzying. When lives hang on your every judgment, you have to be either a fool or a psychopath not to be scared.
But I still stand in this war room, because that is a commander's job.
But WHY?
Hmm?
If you're that scared, Commander, then...why stay here?
Oh, that's easy.
By staying here, I win the chance at protecting every life in my command.
No matter how frightening things may get, you could never pry me away from that.
...Wait, Kirsty was scared? Seriously?
She's never said anything even remotely like that around me.
That must be because she has, um, high expectations of you?
She wanted to be a model for you... Er, at least, that's what I think?
Then when she kept pressing me to accept the promotion, that was...
She knew the fear I felt—even shared it. And still she pushed me to...
She knows you, Joachim. Really well.
And she knows you're kind enough to not want to lose anyone, and, um...strong enough to make it happen.
Yeah, she liked to make with the praise, all right. Every time I did something right, she'd be the first one to tell me.
That's why I...yelled in front of everyone and...pulled you over here to ask...
I mean, I know holding another's life in your hands is unbelievably, um, heavy, a-and all the expectations...
But if we both feel the same, and we don't want to see anyone else get hurt...
Please just do it, Joachim! We NEED you!
Pretty cruel ask, Noelle.
...Sorry.
No, don't apologize. Even I can't just keep stewing after hearing all that.
I feel like I finally understand what Kirsty's expectations for me actually mean.
Th-then you...?!
Running away's easy: just cover your eyes and pretend you never saw a thing.  It's what I've been doing this whole time.
But—and this sounds so obvious when you say it—but if I'd faced my troubles head-on instead of running away, I might have had the chance to save some lives.
I lost my sister, yeah. But right now I've got more people I want to protect. No more running.
*ulp*
Let's get back, Noelle. We don't have long until the enemy's ranks are reformed, and then things are gonna get real busy.
R-right!
Welcome back. What were you two up to, anyway? Some kinda secret chitchat?
She had a message for me. From Kirsty.
Well, whatever it was, you look better. Guess that's not surprising after the boss lady put the fear of god in you.
So, what's the plan? Scouts are saying it looks like the enemy's planning a night raid, which is bad news for us.
Yeah, they've got us beat hands-down in spellcasters. It'll be hard to handle them at night.
But that just means we have to hit 'em before that happens. And I've got a plan for that, but it ain't pretty.
There's not a person here who doesn't trust you with their life, remember?
Heh. Appreciated.
Hey, I'm just stating the obvious. Anyway, fill us in already.
It's basically a repeat of earlier where we use the manacaster as a diversion. Except this time, we can't just sit back.
We keep their flanks pinned down and hit their command center, force a rout. We charge as a group—all of us.
Ha! I love it! They think they've got the numbers? Then we'll go straight for the head.
I take full responsibility for this operation.
...Which is why I'm bringing every one of you idiots home safe. Now move out!
Yes, sir!

Joachim's men are surrounded, and their only hope is to finish things before night falls. With renewed resolve, he takes command and sets forth from the base for a final showdown with their assailants.
I'll go disrupt their ranks, but I need you guys to open a path for me!
Sir, yes, sir!
Gwaaaugh! It's those weird attacks again! Fall back! There's no telling what that thing will do to you if it hits!
Thanks for clearing the way, fellas. Vanguard unit, chaaarge!
I've got you covered. Give 'em hell, Aggie!
What are you fools doing?! Hold the line!
But boss, they're pelting us with something we've never seen before!
Why do you think the client's given us all this armor? We can take some punishment. Now stop your whinging and HOLD THEM BACK ALREADY!
Joachim, the enemy is... They're reeling! Their ranks are starting to...to crumble!
Sounds like the diversion's working... Phase two, people! Like we planned!
Hit 'em with everything and let's settle it! Main force, advance!
Sir!
Commander Balboa's quarters, a few hours later...
Commander, we've received word from the field.
Finally. Let's see how things are doing.
...WHAT?!
Something the matter, Commander? You look a bit green in the gills. Not bad news, I hope?
You little...
Now I see why you kept so calm.
It seems I lose this round—though I must salute the bravery of your men.
You're taking this rather well. I was expecting a lot of ＂You may have won this round, but... blah blah blah.＂
I didn't realize you had a sense of humor. This is quite the rare sight indeed.
But if that was a request, I'm happy to oblige. I assumed you knew without my saying it, but this ISN'T over.
No. Weathering one crisis doesn't mean the situation is resolved.
Then let me give you one final chance, Commander Kirsty.
Hand over the letter from Litvinov, and I will personally guarantee the safety of your men, as well as your rank.
I see little reason to hesitate. This is your most basic duty as a soldier in the king's army, is it not?
And then what? Am I to sit idly by and watch as my country is swallowed up in a fetid swamp of corruption?
We are striving day and night to prevent precisely such a fate. I wish you would understand that.
I would beg to differ. And as ever, I will fight to protect my country as my convictions demand.
If you'll excuse me, Commander.
Commander Kirsty's office, days after the attack...
You asked to see me, Commander?
I wanted to confirm the details of your final report on the incident the other day. Had a few questions for you.
Was there a problem with the brief?
No, it was quite thorough. But there were a few things beyond its scope I wanted to hear straight from the horse's mouth.
What did you gain in course of this operation, Joachim?
You brought me here to ask THAT?
Yes, and you're really going to answer. Everyone around the base was singing your praises, you know.
Well, I DID learn something from it. I'd say I gained exactly what you think I did.
A little cold and calculating to give me that manacaster in the hopes it would change me and get rid of my doubts, no?
I won't deny it; I have no place for one who can't muster at least that much resolve at my side in the days to come.
So you're gonna accept it, then? His offer?
At the very least, I have sufficient cause to send you. Even if I did nothing, the present king's faction will act before long.
Oh, and one more thing: Have you reached an answer regarding that promotion?
Yeah, about that...
...Hey, sis. Sorry it's been a while. Things are a bit nuts back at work.
Although if I'm honest, I've been putting off my visit until I had something to report that'd make you proud...
...But I've got something that fits the bill. A promotion.
Ever since I got you killed, I've been afraid to accept their offer, but now I finally think I'm ready to take it on.
I learned that the woman who believed in me was just as scared as I was, but she still had the guts to make a stand.
So I want to do what I can to be there for her.
Don't think this means I forgot about you, though—I'll never forgive myself for what happened to you, as long as I live.
But that's all the more reason I don't want  to lose anyone else. I can't keep running.
I hope you're watching over me from the great flow of mana, and laughing at every bonehead mistake I make.
J-Joachim!
It's, um, time to move out. Are you ready?
I'm good. Thanks for coming to get me.
Oh, good! So, next deployment is, um... We're going to see ＂him,＂ right?
That's right. Lead the way, Noelle. And we have a letter to bring with us, I think?
Yes, Chelle entrusted it with me... I just... I just hope these talks work out.
Me, too. But hey, that's up to how well we negotiate, right? So let's give it our best.
It's up to us to carve out the future Kirsty's hoping for with our own two hands.
